intro: Benoistia sambiranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar benoistia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the tropical rainforests of Madagascar. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
